gcci.text: With H100 compute now averaging roughly $3.23 per hour—well below 2024’s peak—availability has improved materially, signaling normalization in the supply chain and easing of chip bottlenecks, which should support higher utilization and more selective capex.

gtpi.text: An average input price of about $1.38 per million tokens reflects intense API price compression, encouraging model efficiency gains while pressuring margins and likely accelerating consolidation among providers.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual AI electricity load adds substantial grid strain and emissions pressure, making nuclear baseload and behind-the-meter generation increasingly attractive for reliability and carbon goals.

aipi.text: AI infrastructure growth is robust but tempered by price normalization and cost discipline; the sector’s sustainability hinges on improving utilization and monetizing models at sustainable margins to mitigate bubble risks.
